question: How did the AMD Data Center segment perform in Q3 2024?
ground_truth: The Data Center segment revenue reached a record $3.5 billion in Q3 2024, up 122% year-over-year, driven by strong sales of AMD Instinct GPUs and EPYC CPUs.
generated_answer:
Atomic Facts with Citations:
• AMD Data Center segment had a very strong quarter in Q3 2024, especially for the Instinct product portfolio [C2][C5]
• AMD completed important customer milestones and ramped above initial expectations in Q3 [C5]
• Data Center GPU revenue was very strong in Q3, approaching the size of the compute business which was around $1.7 billion [C6]
• September actuals for Data Center GPU were in the $1.5 billion range [C4]
• AMD raised full-year Data Center GPU guidance from exceeding $4.5 billion to exceeding $5 billion based on completion of customer milestones [C5]
• December Data Center GPU revenue expected to be in the $2 billion range [C4]
 Final Answer:
AMD's Data Center segment delivered exceptional performance in Q3 2024. Data Center GPU revenue: approaching $1.7B (strong sequential growth) [C6]. The segment significantly outperformed expectations, with AMD completing important customer milestones and ramping above initial projections [C5].
Full-year guidance raised: from >$4.5B to >$5B (+$500M increase) [C5]. September actuals reached ~$1.5B, with December projected at ~$2B [C4]. The Instinct product portfolio drove the strong performance, benefiting from customer milestone completions that enabled the guidance raise [C2][C5].
AMD feels confident about the trajectory through year-end, with the Data Center GPU business demonstrating robust sequential momentum and exceeding internal expectations [C5].
